actions.recommendation: Consider seeing a dietician/nutritionist to guide you with making dietary changes to try and reverse high fasting insulin levels.
Regular prostate examinations and PSA blood levels.
You have no current concerns on your clinical examination. If any symptoms or signs arise - to seek medical review from your GP.

I am glad to see you had normal PSA levels on your blood work. As you get older (>40 years) - routine screening becomes important to help early detection & management of any irregularities. In males, this means regular prostate examinations and PSA blood levels.
Hopefully your cholesterol levels improve with some changes in diet and supplements. We will monitor your levels & determine the need for further management.
Vitamin B12 (Methylcobalamin) 500mcg daily, Vitamin D3 5000IU daily, Magnesium Citrate 400mg twice a day.
We will monitor your cholesterol levels.
